description: IMO, the app shouldn't force the user to save the recording before allowing them to replay the audio. Currently, the user must click 'stop' during the recording, click a second time to save the recording, and then click a third time to replay it. Just auto-save the recording, then allow the user to rename the recording afterward, if it's so important that the user name the recording.

In the absolute majority of cases when we record sound from the microphone, we then want to do something with it, be it sending it to someone or importing it into another program. With this program this is not possible.

have tried it during a meeting. It shows leval intensity, so I know it is working. I selected mp3. During playback the display of the audio levals was not in sync with the actual audio. It at least was showing something. For me it did what I wanted. Gave it a 3. Room for improvement. My fan noise from the computer gave it a base leval of noise. That wasn't the program.
Suits my needs and matches my expectations as with most GNOME applications.
Kind of weird that you can't save a file externally.
And you can save the files externally. All files are saved in a folder Recordings under your home directory.
Very good App. If a new animation is provided, it would have been better.
you find the recorded files at recorded folder at home directory

description: The most easy, effective, software. Super Great App. Simple to record, auto safe, easy to rename or delete and record again. Just Great! Super great simple recording app! Click record, Click rename/ delete, click record again! Thanks. Yep love it!

A simple, clean and easy-to use app. However, while I select MP3 as the preferred file-type, whatever file type they are recorded as are not recognised as MP3 by websites I try to upload them too. To do so, I have to convert the supposedly MP3 files recorded to MP3 files. If this issue was addressed this would be a perfect stand-alone audio recording app.

Does not record audio at all. Playback doesn't work either.

Does the job as promised. Simple and handy.

description:
It is a pretty good, simple video recorder. It's good to keep GUI apps simple.

One thing that isn't simple?

Where they are kept. Here's a path of where they usually are.

As another reviewer said, he files are kept in ~/Recordings (/home/your-username/Recordings)

Other than that, it is a simple, easy, audio recorder. GNOME, keep up the good work!
summary: Like it, but there is no explanation where the files are kept!

2. Я смог сделать запись
3. Я смог выбрать тип сохранения.
